The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are addressed in the individual RMP procedures which detail the RMP program requirements as well as how Alta Fuels complies with the applicable requirements. Alta Pueblo is a non-responding facility for releases of the RMP-listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan (EAP).
The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
The Alta Fuels (Alta) Pueblo, Colorado facility is a gasoline blending facility with approximately 400,000 gallons of capacity, blending diesel, ethanol, and blend stock gasoline. The daily average finished product fuel throughput is 150,000 gallons, with a maximum daily throughput of 320,000 gallons. The Pueblo facility has two permanent 30,000-gallon field grade butane tanks for blending. 

Alta Fuels Pueblo uses a flammable mixture (field grade butane) containing three chemicals (n-butane, isobutane, and butene) that are subject to reporting under this filing to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). The field grade butane is stored in two permanent 30,000-gallon tanks used to inject field grade butane into their gasoline loading operations for blending. Each tank is administratively controlled to an 85% level limit, has excess flow valves on the vapor and liquid lines and has three (3) pressure relief valves. Field grade butane is unloaded from a tank wagon into either tank and stored liquefied under pressure; the tanks are manifolded such that one can be online while the other is being filled. Liquid field grade butane is pumped from the online tank through a loading rack meter to an inline mixer where it is blended with gasoline immediately prior to loading the outbound gasoline tank wagons.
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:
Alta Fuels has a

program in place to comply with the provisions of the accidental release prevention regulations under 40 CFR Part 68. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the existing release prevention program.

Process Safety Information [40 CFR Part 68.65]
Alta Fuels maintains a record of process safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all processes.

Process Hazard Analysis [40 CFR Part 68.67]
Comprehensive analyses ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled efficiently. The methodology used to carry out these analyses is HAZOP. The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at least every 5 years. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

Written Operating Procedures [40 CFR Part 68.69]
To ensure safe operations, Alta Fuels maintains written operating procedures. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations and normal shutdown. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

Employee Training [40 CFR Part 68.71]
Alta Fuels has a training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating plant processes are competent in the applicable operating procedures. Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity [40 CFR Part 68.73]
Alta Fuels carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operations. Inspected process equipment includes pressure vessels, piping systems, pressure relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps. Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices. Furth

ermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Management of Change [MOC] [40 CFR Part 68.75]
Written procedures are in place at Alta Fuels to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures. Facility operators or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification(s).

Pre-Startup Safety Review [PSSR] [40 CFR Part 68.77]
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and modifications to existing processes are conducted routinely at Alta Fuels. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits [40 CFR Part 68.79]
Alta Fuels conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the US EPA RMP and OSHA PSM regulations are being implemented. These audits are conducted at least every 3 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a timely manner.

Incident Investigation [40 CFR Part 68.81]
Alta Fuels investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in, a catastrophic release of a regulated substance within 48 hours. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum period of 5 years.

Employee Participation [40 CFR Part 68.83]
Alta Fuels believes that Process Safety Management and accident prevention is a team effort. Employees are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, Alta Fuels employees have access to all information created as part of th

e facility's implementation of the RMP and PSM rules, including information resulting from Process Hazard Analyses.

Hot Work Permit [40 CFR Part 68.85]
Alta Fuels has a hot work program that requires issuance of a hot work permit for hot work operations conducted on or near the covered process. 

Contractor Safety Program [40 CFR Part 68.87] 
Alta Fuels occasionally hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is carried out. Alta Fuels has a policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards associated with the contractor's work and the corresponding processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response in the event of an accidental release of a regulated substance.
The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:
The Alta Pueblo has had zero RMP reportable incidents in the previous five years.
The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
As a non-responding site, the Alta Pueblo facility has developed a written Emergency Action Plan (EAP) that includes activation of the local emergency notification system and calling 911 from a safe location [29 CFR 1910.38(c)(1)] and directing an evacuation, including exit route assignments [29 CFR 1910.38(c)(2)]. All employees are trained to assist other employees in a safe and orderly evacuation [29 CFR 1910.38(c)(2)]. Should the scope of any incident exceed the capability of Alta staff, such as a large flammable gas release, fire, or explosion at the facility, the employee discovering emergency shall follow the protocol provided in the EAP to notify facility personnel, isolate the covered process if safe to do so, evacuate the facility and perform headcount at the designated muster point, and contact emergency responders. Emergency exit routes are through any available gate for this outdoor location and muster points for each facility are identif

ied in the Facility Maps. Note that there are no facility processes that would require continued operation during an emergency.

Fire extinguishers are available at several locations within the plant site to assist with the response of small, incipient fires. Facility employees should only administer the fire extinguishers if the fire is within the capacity of the extinguisher and if the employee is trained to do so [29 CFR 1910.119(n)].
Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
Alta Fuels is working to address the recommendations identified in the most recent compliance audit and PHA. Alta Fuels is committed to improving their safety systems and prioritizes these recommendations accordingly. Future changes will be reviewed under the Management of Change (MOC) element and will address potential changes to improve safety as part of the MOC process.

Alta Fuels has completed this report to provide the public with information about our activities at this facility.  We believe that the many controls instituted to maintain a safe operation, and our commitment to continuous improvement that an incident affecting our employees or the surrounding area is unlikely to occur.
